p: Sindbis virus, one of the most common and studied arbovirus in Europe [ 29], has been shown to successfully infect both primary human myoblasts and myotubes in vitro, with detection of viral antigens and observation of cytopathic effects on infected cells [ 31]. However, it has not yet been fully elucidated as to whether different strains of SINV are equally pathogenic in muscle [ 29, 31].
